intro: Psoralea pullata, commonly known as the small-flowered psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume fruits and often nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is found in arid and semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers arranged in dense spikes, and its leaves are pinnately compound. Psoralea pullata is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and role in soil stabilization.
